sites.name: Van Abbemuseum
sites.description: The Van Abbemuseum is one of Europe's leading museums for modern and contemporary art. Founded in 1936, it houses an extensive collection including works by Picasso, Chagall, Kandinsky, and Mondrian. The museum's striking modern building, designed by Abel Cahen, features innovative exhibition spaces and a distinctive glass facade. The collection focuses on modern art movements and contemporary artists, with special attention to Dutch and international avant-garde movements.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with climate-controlled galleries. Special exhibitions rotate throughout the year. Summer brings outdoor installations and events. Museum closed on Mondays except during holidays. Extended hours on Thursday evenings with special programming.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended for special exhibitions. Museum card accepted. Guided tours available in multiple languages. Located in city center near train station. Café on premises with outdoor seating in summer.

sites.name: Philips Museum
sites.description: The Philips Museum tells the story of how a small light bulb factory grew into one of the world's largest technology companies. Located in the original Philips factory building from 1891, the museum showcases the company's history through interactive exhibits, historic products, and multimedia presentations. Visitors can explore the evolution of technology from the first light bulbs to modern healthcare innovations.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round except Mondays. Special exhibitions highlight different aspects of Philips history. School holidays bring family-oriented programming. Museum closed on major holidays. Extended hours during special events.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended. Guided tours available for groups. Located in city center near train station. Museum shop offers Philips-branded souvenirs. Café on premises.

sites.name: Eindhoven Design District
sites.description: The Eindhoven Design District is a vibrant area showcasing the city's creative spirit through design studios, galleries, and innovative architecture. The district includes the Strijp-S area, a former Philips industrial complex transformed into a creative hub. Visitors can explore design shops, art galleries, and creative workspaces while experiencing the city's modern architectural transformation.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round. Dutch Design Week in October brings special events and exhibitions. Summer brings outdoor markets and events. Winter features light installations and holiday markets. Regular design markets throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general exploration. Guided tours available for design district. Many shops closed on Sundays. Located near city center, accessible by foot or bicycle. Multiple cafés and restaurants in area.

sites.name: PSV Museum
sites.description: The PSV Museum celebrates the history of PSV Eindhoven, one of the Netherlands' most successful football clubs. Located in the Philips Stadium, the museum features trophies, memorabilia, and interactive exhibits about the club's history. Visitors can explore the stadium, see the team's achievements, and learn about famous players who have represented the club.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round except match days. Special exhibitions during major tournaments. Closed during major holidays. Stadium tours available on non-match days. Extended hours during special events.
sites.booking_tips: Advance booking recommended for stadium tours. Museum entry included with stadium tour. Located near city center, accessible by public transport. Shop offers PSV merchandise. Café on premises.

sites.name: Daf Museum
sites.description: The DAF Museum tells the story of the Dutch truck and car manufacturer DAF, showcasing its history from the 1920s to the present. The museum features historic vehicles, interactive exhibits about automotive technology, and displays about DAF's innovations in truck manufacturing. Visitors can see classic cars, trucks, and learn about the company's engineering achievements.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round except Mondays. Special exhibitions focus on different aspects of DAF history. School holidays bring family programming. Closed on major holidays. Extended hours during special events.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended. Guided tours available for groups. Located near city center. Museum shop offers DAF merchandise. Café on premises.

sites.name: Genneper Parken
sites.description: Genneper Parken is a large recreational area combining nature, sports facilities, and cultural attractions. The park includes walking and cycling trails, sports fields, and the Genneper Watermill. The area features diverse landscapes including forests, meadows, and water features, making it a popular destination for outdoor activities and relaxation.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round. Spring brings flowering plants and new growth. Summer offers outdoor activities and events. Autumn features colorful foliage. Winter brings opportunities for ice skating when conditions allow. Regular events throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general access. Some facilities require advance booking. Located south of city center, accessible by bicycle or public transport. Multiple cafés and restaurants in area.

sites.name: Dutch Design Week
sites.description: Dutch Design Week is the largest design event in Northern Europe, held annually in Eindhoven. For nine days in October, the city transforms into a showcase for Dutch design talent, featuring exhibitions, workshops, lectures, and events throughout the city. The event attracts designers, architects, and creative professionals from around the world.
sites.seasonal_notes: Held annually in October. Multiple venues throughout the city. Indoor and outdoor events. Special programming for professionals and public. Extended hours during festival period.
sites.booking_tips: Advance tickets recommended for popular events. Festival pass available for full access. Many events require separate booking. Located throughout city center and design district. Special shuttle service during event.

sites.name: St. Catherine's Church
sites.description: St. Catherine's Church is a historic Catholic church in the heart of Eindhoven. Built in the 19th century, the church features neo-Gothic architecture and impressive stained glass windows. The church serves as both a place of worship and a cultural landmark, hosting regular services and occasional concerts.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round for services and visits. Special services during holidays. Regular organ concerts. Closed during private events. Extended hours during special occasions.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general visits. Guided tours available by appointment. Located in city center. Photography permitted except during services. Donations appreciated.

sites.name: Eindhoven Museum
sites.description: The Eindhoven Museum is an open-air museum that brings history to life through reconstructed buildings and historical demonstrations. The museum focuses on the Iron Age and Middle Ages, offering visitors the chance to experience life in these periods through interactive exhibits and living history demonstrations.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open March through October. Special events during school holidays. Demonstrations and workshops scheduled throughout season. Closed during winter months. Extended hours during special events.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended. Guided tours available. Located in Genneper Parken. Demonstrations scheduled on weekends. Café on premises.

sites.name: Kazerne
sites.description: Kazerne is a creative hub and cultural venue located in a former military barracks. The space hosts exhibitions, design events, and cultural programming throughout the year. The venue combines historical architecture with contemporary design, serving as a platform for emerging artists and designers.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round except Mondays. Regular exhibitions and events. Special programming during Dutch Design Week. Extended hours during special events. Closed on major holidays.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general visits. Special events may require tickets. Located in city center. Café on premises. Regular guided tours available.

sites.name: Evoluon
sites.description: The Evoluon is a distinctive flying-saucer-shaped building that originally opened as a science museum in 1966 by Philips. After several years as a conference center, it has been renovated and reopened as an innovation and technology experience center. The building itself is an architectural landmark of Eindhoven, with its futuristic design representing the city's focus on innovation.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Special exhibitions and technology showcases rotate throughout the year. Evening events and light shows during winter months. Extended hours during Dutch Design Week.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended. Group discounts available. Located slightly outside city center, accessible by public transport. Café on premises with panoramic views. Gift shop sells technology and design-focused merchandise.

sites.name: Piet Hein Eek Factory
sites.description: The Piet Hein Eek Factory is a creative complex established by renowned Dutch designer Piet Hein Eek. Located in a former Philips factory in the Strijp-R area, the space combines a design studio, showroom, gallery, restaurant, and shop. Visitors can watch artisans at work, explore sustainable design concepts, and see how discarded materials are transformed into high-end furniture and objects.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round except Sundays and Mondays. Studio tours available on weekdays. Special events during Dutch Design Week. Restaurant opens for lunch and dinner. Shop hours extended on Saturdays.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for showroom visits. Reservations recommended for restaurant. Studio tours require advance booking. Located in Strijp-R area, accessible by bicycle or public transport. On-site parking available.

sites.name: Blob
sites.description: The Blob is a distinctive blob-shaped building designed by Italian architect Massimiliano Fuksas and completed in 2010. Located in the heart of Eindhoven's shopping district, the futuristic structure houses retail spaces and has become an iconic part of the city's urban landscape. Its unusual organic form and translucent skin create a striking contrast to the surrounding traditional architecture.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round during retail hours. Exterior illuminated at night, creating a dramatic visual in the city center. Special lighting displays during GLOW Festival. Extended hours during shopping events and holidays.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Located in city center shopping district. Surrounded by cafés and restaurants. Photography permitted of exterior and public spaces. Best viewed from 18 Septemberplein.

sites.name: PreHistorisch Dorp
sites.description: PreHistorisch Dorp (Prehistoric Village) is an open-air archaeological museum that recreates prehistoric and early historic settlements. Visitors can experience daily life from the Stone Age through the Middle Ages through reconstructed buildings, demonstrations of ancient crafts, and interactive activities. Historical interpreters in period costume demonstrate techniques such as fire-making, blacksmithing, pottery, and cooking.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open March through October. Summer features full demonstration schedule and hands-on activities. Special events during school holidays. Historical festivals with reenactments held seasonally. Reduced programming during winter months.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended. Family passes available. Located in Genneper Parken. Educational programs for school groups. Café serves historical-inspired meals. Gift shop sells handcrafted replicas.

sites.name: GLOW Eindhoven
sites.description: GLOW Eindhoven is an annual light art festival that transforms the city into an open-air gallery of illuminated artworks and installations. For one week in November, international artists create light-based artworks that interact with the city's architecture and public spaces. The walking route takes visitors through the city center and cultural districts, highlighting both historic and contemporary aspects of Eindhoven.
sites.seasonal_notes: Held annually in November. All installations illuminated from 18:30 to 23:00. Special opening ceremony first evening. Additional indoor exhibitions and events throughout festival period. Workshops and talks during daytime hours.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general access. Guided tours available with advance booking. Located throughout city center with marked walking route. Food stalls along route. Public transport extended during festival evenings. App available with installation information.

sites.name: NatLab
sites.description: NatLab is a cultural center housed in the former Philips Physics Laboratory. The space now combines cinema, theater, and exhibition spaces with a focus on the intersection of art, science, and technology. The complex preserves elements of its industrial heritage while providing a platform for contemporary cultural programming.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Film festivals throughout the year. Theater season runs September through May. Summer features outdoor screenings and performances. Extended hours during special events and festivals.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets recommended for films and performances. Membership offers discounts. Located in Strijp-S area. Restaurant on premises serving lunch and dinner. Exhibitions generally free to enter.

sites.name: Het Veem
sites.description: Het Veem is a creative workspace and cultural hub located in a former industrial building in the Strijp-S district. The complex houses design studios, creative businesses, exhibition spaces, and event venues. The building maintains its industrial character while providing a platform for emerging talent in design, technology, and creative industries.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round during weekdays and Saturdays. Special exhibitions during Dutch Design Week. Regular design markets and events. Summer brings outdoor activities and food festivals. Extended hours during special events.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general visits. Special events may require tickets. Located in Strijp-S area. Café on premises. Accessible by public transport. Regular guided tours available.

sites.name: Inkijkmuseum
sites.description: The Inkijkmuseum (Look-In Museum) is a unique micro-museum located in a former shop. Rather than entering the space, visitors look through the windows to see changing art installations and miniature exhibitions. The concept challenges traditional museum formats and brings art into public space, allowing visitors to experience curated displays at any time of day.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round, 24 hours a day. Exhibitions change monthly. Special installations during Dutch Design Week and GLOW Festival. Winter features light-based installations. Summer showcases emerging artists.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Viewable from street at any time. Located in Dommelstraat. Information available via QR code on window. Close to city center restaurants and cafés.

sites.name: MU Artspace
sites.description: MU Artspace is a contemporary art institution that focuses on emerging talent and interdisciplinary projects. Located in the Strijp-S area, the gallery presents exhibitions that explore the boundaries between art, design, technology, and society. With a focus on current developments and experimental approaches, MU provides a platform for innovative artistic practices.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round except Mondays. Exhibitions change quarterly. Special programming during Dutch Design Week. Artist talks and workshops scheduled throughout the year. Extended hours during exhibition openings.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for general visits. Workshops require advance booking. Located in Strijp-S area. Gallery staff provide information about exhibitions. Public guided tours on weekend afternoons.

sites.name: Radio Royaal
sites.description: Radio Royaal is a restaurant located in a former radio factory in the Strijp-S district. The industrial space has been transformed into a unique dining venue that preserves much of the original factory character. The high ceilings, large windows, and historic machinery create a distinctive atmosphere that connects to Eindhoven's industrial heritage.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round for dinner, lunch service Thursday to Sunday. Seasonal menu changes quarterly. Special events during Dutch Design Week. Summer features outdoor seating. Live music on selected evenings.
sites.booking_tips: Reservations recommended, especially for evenings and weekends. Located in Strijp-S area. Accessible by public transport. Private dining available for groups. Bar area available without reservation.

neighborhoods.name: Eindhoven Centrum
neighborhoods.character: Modern city center with a mix of historic buildings and contemporary architecture, featuring the main shopping area, cultural venues, and the city's main square.

location.description: The heart of Eindhoven, centered around 18 Septemberplein and the Markt, featuring a pedestrian-friendly shopping area and cultural venues.

history.overview: Originally a medieval town, transformed during the industrial revolution by Philips, becoming a modern city center while preserving some historic elements.
history.significance: Represents Eindhoven's evolution from a small town to a major industrial and technological center.
notable_events: Medieval origins as a fortified town
Modern development as a design and technology hub

practical_info.safety: Very safe with busy daytime activity and well-lit evening areas; normal city caution advised at night.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Weekday mornings for shopping; evening for dining and nightlife.
practical_info.walkability: Highly walkable with extensive pedestrian areas and good public transport connections.

attractions.name: 18 Septemberplein
attractions.description: Main square of Eindhoven, featuring modern architecture and serving as a central meeting point.
attractions.appeal: Experience the city's pulse with various events, markets, and people watching.

attractions.name: Philips Museum
attractions.description: Museum showcasing the history of Philips and its impact on Eindhoven.
attractions.appeal: Learn about the city's industrial heritage and technological innovation.

attractions.name: Van Abbemuseum
attractions.description: Modern art museum with an impressive collection of contemporary works.
attractions.appeal: Explore cutting-edge art in a striking modern building.

dining.name: Zarzo
dining.atmosphere: Elegant, minimalist space with open kitchen.

dining.name: De Burger
dining.atmosphere: Hip, industrial-chic space with communal tables.

dining.name: Down Town Gourmet Market
dining.known_for: Various food stalls with global cuisine
dining.atmosphere: Lively market setting with multiple vendors.

activities.name: Shopping Tour
activities.description: Explore the main shopping streets and department stores.

activities.name: Cultural Venues Tour
activities.description: Visit major museums and cultural venues in the city center.

stay_here_if: You want to be in the heart of the city.
You enjoy shopping and cultural activities.
You prefer easy access to public transport.
avoid_if: You prefer green spaces over urban areas.
insider_tips: Visit the weekly market on 18 Septemberplein for local products and atmosphere.
The side streets off the main shopping area often have the most interesting boutiques.
Many restaurants offer early bird specials before the evening rush.

neighborhoods.name: Strijp-S
neighborhoods.character: Former Philips industrial complex transformed into a creative hub, featuring design studios, cultural venues, and innovative businesses.

location.description: Located northwest of the city center, former Philips factory complex now redeveloped as a creative district.

history.overview: Originally built as Philips' main factory complex, transformed in the 2000s into a creative and cultural district after the company's departure.
history.significance: Represents Eindhoven's transition from industrial to creative economy.

practical_info.safety: Very safe with good lighting and regular activity; industrial-chic atmosphere.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Weekdays for business; weekends for events and markets.
practical_info.walkability: Very walkable with wide paths and clear signage.

attractions.name: Klokgebouw
attractions.description: Former Philips clock factory now housing creative businesses and events.
attractions.appeal: Experience the industrial heritage while exploring contemporary design.

attractions.name: Philips Stadium
attractions.description: Home of PSV Eindhoven football club, located on the edge of Strijp-S.
attractions.appeal: Visit the stadium and museum of one of the Netherlands' most successful football clubs.

attractions.name: Strijp-S Square
attractions.description: Central square in the creative district featuring events and markets.
attractions.appeal: Experience the district's creative atmosphere and community events.

dining.name: Usine
dining.atmosphere: Former factory converted into trendy café.

activities.name: Design District Tour
activities.description: Explore the creative businesses and design studios.

activities.name: PSV Stadium Tour
activities.description: Guided tour of the Philips Stadium and PSV Museum.

stay_here_if: You're interested in design and innovation.
You want to experience Eindhoven's creative side.
avoid_if: You prefer traditional city center locations.
You're looking for extensive shopping options.
insider_tips: Visit during Dutch Design Week for the district's most vibrant atmosphere.
Many creative businesses have open studios on certain days - check local listings.
The industrial architecture looks particularly striking at sunset.

neighborhoods.name: Woensel
neighborhoods.character: Large, diverse district featuring residential areas, shopping centers, and the city's largest market.

location.description: Located north of the city center, featuring both residential neighborhoods and commercial areas.

history.overview: Originally a separate village, incorporated into Eindhoven in 1920, developed as a major residential and commercial area.
history.significance: Represents Eindhoven's expansion and urbanization in the 20th century.

practical_info.safety: Generally safe with busy commercial areas; normal urban awareness advised.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Weekdays for shopping; market days for local atmosphere.
practical_info.walkability: Good in commercial areas; residential areas require more walking.

attractions.name: Woenselse Markt
attractions.description: Eindhoven's largest outdoor market with various vendors.
attractions.appeal: Experience local shopping culture and find fresh produce.

attractions.name: Winkelcentrum Woensel
attractions.description: Large shopping center with various stores and services.

attractions.name: Kennedyplein
attractions.description: Busy commercial area with shops and restaurants.

dining.name: Van der Poel Poffertjes
dining.atmosphere: Market stand with authentic Dutch treats.

dining.name: De Stroopwafel
dining.atmosphere: Market stand with traditional Dutch sweets.

activities.name: Market Shopping
activities.description: Explore the largest market in Eindhoven.

activities.name: Neighborhood Exploration
activities.description: Experience residential Eindhoven life.

stay_here_if: You want to experience local Eindhoven life.
avoid_if: You want to be near major tourist attractions.
You're looking for extensive nightlife options.
insider_tips: Visit the market early morning for the best selection.
Many local restaurants offer good value lunch specials.
The residential areas have some interesting post-war architecture.

neighborhoods.name: Philipsdorp
neighborhoods.character: Historic residential area built by Philips for its workers, featuring distinctive architecture and a strong sense of community.

location.description: Located northwest of the city center, adjacent to Strijp-S, featuring planned residential development from the early 20th century.

history.overview: Developed by Philips in the early 1900s as housing for its workers, becoming a model for industrial housing development.
history.significance: Represents early 20th-century industrial housing development and social planning.

practical_info.safety: Very safe residential area with strong community feeling.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Daytime for architecture; weekends for community events.
practical_info.walkability: Highly walkable with tree-lined streets and historic architecture.

attractions.name: Historic Worker Houses
attractions.description: Well-preserved early 20th-century housing built by Philips.
attractions.appeal: Admire the distinctive architecture and urban planning.

attractions.name: Philipsdorp Church
attractions.description: Historic church serving the Philips workers' community.
attractions.appeal: View the architectural style typical of industrial housing developments.

attractions.name: Philips Park
attractions.description: Green space in the historic neighborhood.
attractions.appeal: Relax in a historic setting with local residents.

dining.name: Philipsdorp Eetcafé
dining.atmosphere: Historic café serving the local community.

activities.name: Architectural Walking Tour
activities.description: Explore the historic architecture and urban planning.

activities.name: Community Events
activities.description: Participate in neighborhood gatherings and events.

stay_here_if: You want to experience historic residential life.
avoid_if: You want to be near shopping and entertainment.
You're looking for extensive dining options.
insider_tips: Visit during community events to experience local life.
The architecture looks particularly good in early morning light.
Many residents maintain their historic homes with great care.

fine_dining.name: De Karpendonkse Hoeve
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant dining in a historic farmhouse with garden views
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book 2-3 weeks in advance, especially for weekend dinners
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef creates dishes highlighting local Brabant produce; their garden terrace is perfect for summer dining

fine_dining.name: Zarzo
fine_dining.atmosphere: Modern, minimalist space with open kitchen
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve at least 2 weeks in advance, closed Sunday and Monday
fine_dining.local_tips: Their wine pairings are exceptional; the chef's tasting menu changes weekly based on local ingredients

fine_dining.name: De Zwaan
fine_dining.atmosphere: Contemporary dining room in historic building
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book 2 weeks in advance, request window seating for city views
fine_dining.local_tips: Located in the historic Philips building; their private dining room offers panoramic city views

fine_dining.name: Dinner in Motion
fine_dining.atmosphere: Innovative dining experience with multimedia elements
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve 3-4 weeks ahead, experience includes show elements
fine_dining.local_tips: Unique dining experience combining food with technology and entertainment; perfect for special occasions

fine_dining.name: De Vooruitgang
fine_dining.atmosphere: Industrial-chic space in former Philips building
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book 2 weeks ahead, lunch offers excellent value
fine_dining.local_tips: Located in the creative heart of Eindhoven; their terrace is perfect for summer dining

casual_dining.name: De Burger
casual_dining.atmosphere: Hip, industrial-chic space with communal tables
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations; expect a wait during peak hours
casual_dining.local_tips: All beef is locally sourced; their homemade sauces are exceptional

casual_dining.name: Usine
casual_dining.atmosphere: Former Philips factory converted into trendy café
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations; arrive early for lunch
casual_dining.local_tips: Great spot for breakfast and lunch; their coffee is roasted in-house

casual_dining.name: De Kazerne
casual_dining.atmosphere: Former military barracks turned creative hub
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations; popular with design community
casual_dining.local_tips: Part of a creative hub; often hosts food-related events and pop-ups

casual_dining.name: Down Town Gourmet Market
casual_dining.atmosphere: Lively food market with multiple vendors
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations; popular with students and young professionals
casual_dining.local_tips: Great for sampling different cuisines; perfect for groups with different tastes

casual_dining.name: De Bakkerij
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations; arrive early for best selection
casual_dining.local_tips: All breads baked fresh daily; their sourdough is particularly good

street_food.name: Woenselse Markt
street_food.local_tips: Eindhoven's largest market; best on Saturday when all vendors are present

street_food.name: Food Truck Festival
street_food.hours: Various locations and times throughout the year
street_food.local_tips: Regular food truck gatherings; check local event calendar for dates

street_food.name: De Frietboetiek
street_food.local_tips: Best fries in Eindhoven; try their homemade sauces

street_food.name: Van der Poel Poffertjes
street_food.local_tips: Family-run stand with authentic Dutch mini-pancakes

street_food.name: De Stroopwafel
street_food.local_tips: Made fresh on the spot; perfect for gifts

coffee_shops.name: Lucifer Coffee Roasters
coffee_shops.local_tips: They roast their own beans; watch the roasting process through the glass partition

coffee_shops.name: Van Moll
coffee_shops.local_tips: Combines craft beer brewing with specialty coffee; unique experience

coffee_shops.name: Coffee Lab
coffee_shops.local_tips: Innovative coffee techniques; perfect for coffee enthusiasts

coffee_shops.name: De Bakkerij
coffee_shops.local_tips: All pastries baked fresh daily; perfect for breakfast

coffee_shops.name: Stadsbrouwerij 040
coffee_shops.local_tips: Unique combination of brewery and coffee roastery; great for groups

bars.name: Van Moll
bars.local_tips: Brew their own beers on-site; regular beer tasting events

bars.name: De Effenaar
bars.atmosphere: Historic music venue with multiple bars
bars.local_tips: Iconic music venue; check their calendar for live events

bars.name: De Oude Rechtbank
bars.local_tips: Historic building with unique atmosphere; great for traditional Dutch drinks

bars.name: Stratumseind
bars.atmosphere: Longest bar street in the Netherlands
bars.local_tips: Over 50 bars in one street; perfect for bar hopping

bars.name: De Markt
bars.atmosphere: Historic market square with multiple bars
bars.local_tips: Central square with many bars; great for people watching

food_tours.name: Eindhoven Design & Dining Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Book at least a week in advance; combines food with Eindhoven's design culture

food_tours.name: Eindhoven Craft Beer Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Reserve 7-10 days ahead; includes multiple beer tastings

food_tours.name: Eindhoven Street Food Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Book early for weekend tours; explores local market culture

cooking_classes.name: Brabant Cooking Workshop
includes: All ingredients, recipes, full meal with beer and wine
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Reserve 2 weeks ahead; held in a traditional setting

cooking_classes.name: Modern Dutch Cooking
includes: All ingredients, recipe booklet, full meal
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Book at least 10 days in advance; suitable for all skill levels

markets.name: Woenselse Markt
markets.local_tips: Saturday is the largest market day; arrive early for the best selection

markets.name: Strijp-S Food Market
markets.local_tips: Part of the creative district; check calendar for specific dates

markets.name: Wilhelminaplein
markets.local_tips: Concentration of quality food shops; perfect for gourmet shopping

destinations.whyGo: Experience the Netherlands' vibrant capital with its iconic canals, world-class museums, and distinctive architecture.
Discover the Netherlands' second-largest city known for its modern architecture, innovative design, and bustling harbor.
Visit the seat of Dutch government, international courts, royal palaces, and beautiful North Sea beaches.
Explore this historic city with its iconic Dom Tower, charming canals, and rich cultural heritage.
Discover the medieval capital of North Brabant with its impressive Gothic cathedral, unique underground canals, and connection to painter Hieronymus Bosch.
Experience this vibrant university city known for its textile history, contemporary art scene, and annual funfair.
Discover the southernmost Dutch city with its distinctive regional character, historic architecture, and gastronomic excellence.
Explore the EU capital with its magnificent Grand Place, Art Nouveau architecture, and renowned chocolate and beer.
Visit Belgium's second city known for its diamond trade, fashion scene, and magnificent cathedral and train station.
Experience this sophisticated Rhine metropolis known for its fashion industry, modern architecture, and Japanese quarter.
Visit this Rhine River city dominated by its magnificent Gothic cathedral and known for its vibrant cultural scene.
Explore one of the world's most dynamic cities with its historic landmarks, cultural diversity, and cutting-edge arts scene.
Experience the iconic City of Light with its world-famous landmarks, unparalleled museums, and legendary culinary scene.
Discover Germany's dynamic capital with its turbulent history, cutting-edge arts scene, and legendary nightlife.
Visit this historic city with its beautiful Grote Kerk, charming city center, and rich cultural heritage.
Experience this border city with its historic center, Limburg hospitality, and proximity to Germany.
Explore the Netherlands' oldest city with its rich Roman history, scenic riverfront, and lively university atmosphere.
Experience this historic city known for Operation Market Garden in WWII, the impressive Netherlands Open Air Museum, and the Kröller-Müller Museum nearby.
Visit the Netherlands' largest theme park with its fairy-tale themed attractions, magical atmosphere, and family-friendly entertainment.
Visit the world's largest flower garden during spring when millions of tulips, daffodils, and hyacinths create spectacular displays.

activities.name: Dutch Design Week
activities.description: Experience the largest design event in Northern Europe, showcasing innovative designs, exhibitions, and events throughout Eindhoven.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held annually in October, this major design event transforms the city into a showcase of Dutch design talent.
activities.booking_tips: Many events are free, but popular exhibitions and workshops require advance booking. Check the official website for program details.

activities.name: Philips Museum Spring Exhibition
activities.description: Explore special spring exhibitions at the Philips Museum, focusing on innovation and technology.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring brings special exhibitions and interactive displays highlighting Philips' technological innovations.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online in advance; guided tours available for groups.

activities.name: Strijp-S Spring Market
activities.description: Visit the creative district's spring market featuring local designers, artists, and food vendors.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in April/May, showcasing spring-themed designs and local products.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; arrive early for the best selection of unique items.

activities.name: King's Day (Koningsdag)
activities.description: Join the nationwide celebration with street parties, orange outfits, and free markets throughout Eindhoven.
activities.seasonal_notes: Celebrated on April 27th (or April 26th if the 27th falls on a Sunday), featuring city-wide festivities.
activities.booking_tips: No reservation needed; the main celebrations are centered around 18 Septemberplein.

activities.name: Spring Beer Festival
activities.description: Sample seasonal craft beers from Dutch breweries at this popular beer festival.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in April/May, featuring spring-themed beers and local specialties.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets in advance; sessions often sell out quickly.

activities.name: Eindhoven Marathon
activities.description: Participate in or watch the annual marathon through Eindhoven's streets.
activities.price_range: Free to watch, Moderate to participate
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in October, offering perfect running conditions.
activities.booking_tips: Register months in advance if participating; great spectator spots along the route.

activities.name: Spring Art Walk
activities.description: Explore Eindhoven's art galleries and public installations during this seasonal event.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring brings special exhibitions and outdoor art installations throughout the city.
activities.booking_tips: Pick up a map from the tourist office; some galleries require advance booking.

activities.name: Food Truck Festival
activities.description: Sample diverse cuisines from food trucks gathered in Eindhoven's creative district.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in spring, featuring international street food and local specialties.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; arrive early for popular food trucks.

activities.name: GLOW Festival
activities.description: Experience Eindhoven's light art festival, transforming the city with spectacular light installations.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in November, creating a magical atmosphere with light art throughout the city.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; follow the marked route through the city center.

activities.name: Strijp-S Summer Festival
activities.description: Enjoy music, food, and cultural events in the creative district.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer brings outdoor events and performances to the industrial-chic setting.
activities.booking_tips: Check the festival website for specific event schedules and ticket requirements.

activities.name: Philips Stadium Tour
activities.description: Visit PSV Eindhoven's stadium and museum during the summer break.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer offers guided tours of the stadium and PSV Museum.
activities.booking_tips: Book tours in advance through the PSV website.

activities.name: Summer Terrace Dining
activities.description: Enjoy outdoor dining at restaurants throughout Eindhoven.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer brings extended terrace hours and pleasant outdoor dining.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve terrace tables in advance, especially for weekend evenings.

activities.name: Eindhoven Open Air Cinema
activities.description: Watch movies under the stars in various locations throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer evenings bring outdoor film screenings to various venues.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets in advance; bring warm clothing for evening screenings.

activities.name: Stratumseind Street Festival
activities.description: Experience the longest bar street in the Netherlands during its summer festival.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer brings extended outdoor seating and street entertainment.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; arrive early for the best spots.

activities.name: Van Abbemuseum Summer Exhibitions
activities.description: Explore contemporary art exhibitions at the Van Abbemuseum.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer brings special exhibitions and art installations.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online; guided tours available.

activities.name: Summer Music Festival
activities.description: Enjoy live music performances throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer brings various music festivals and outdoor concerts.
activities.booking_tips: Check local listings for specific events and ticket requirements.

activities.name: Dutch Design Week
activities.description: Experience the largest design event in Northern Europe.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held annually in October, showcasing Dutch design talent.
activities.booking_tips: Many events are free, but popular exhibitions require advance booking.

activities.name: Eindhoven Museum Autumn Festival
activities.description: Experience historical demonstrations and autumn activities at the open-air museum.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings special historical demonstrations and seasonal activities.
activities.booking_tips: Check the museum website for special autumn events.

activities.name: Autumn Food Festival
activities.description: Sample seasonal dishes and local specialties.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings harvest-themed food events and tastings.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets in advance for food tastings and workshops.

activities.name: Philips Museum Innovation Week
activities.description: Explore special exhibitions focusing on technological innovation.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings special technology-focused exhibitions and demonstrations.
activities.booking_tips: Book guided tours in advance for groups.

activities.name: Autumn Art Walk
activities.description: Explore galleries and art installations throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings special art exhibitions and installations.
activities.booking_tips: Pick up a map from the tourist office for the art walk route.

activities.name: PSV Match Experience
activities.description: Watch a PSV Eindhoven football match at the Philips Stadium.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings regular football matches and special events.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets well in advance for popular matches.

activities.name: Autumn Beer Festival
activities.description: Sample seasonal beers from Dutch breweries.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings special beer tastings and brewery events.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets in advance; sessions often sell out.

activities.name: Strijp-S Autumn Market
activities.description: Browse autumn-themed designs and products in the creative district.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings seasonal products and designs to the market.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; arrive early for the best selection.

activities.name: Winter Festival Eindhoven
activities.description: Experience winter magic with illuminations and festive activities.
activities.seasonal_notes: December brings festive lights and winter activities throughout the city.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required for general access; special events may require tickets.

activities.name: Ice Skating at 18 Septemberplein
activities.description: Skate on the seasonal ice rink in the city center.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter brings the popular ice rink to the main square.
activities.booking_tips: No reservations needed; skate rental available onsite.

activities.name: Sinterklaas Arrival
activities.description: Experience the Dutch tradition of Sinterklaas arriving in Eindhoven.
activities.seasonal_notes: Sinterklaas arrives in mid-November with celebrations until December 5th.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; arrive early for good viewing spots.

activities.name: Christmas Market
activities.description: Browse holiday gifts and enjoy festive atmosphere.
activities.seasonal_notes: December brings festive markets and holiday shopping.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; visit in the evening for the festive atmosphere.

activities.name: Winter Beer Festival
activities.description: Sample seasonal winter beers and specialties.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter brings special beer tastings and warming drinks.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets in advance; sessions often sell out.

activities.name: New Year's Eve Celebration
activities.description: Ring in the new year with fireworks and celebrations.
activities.seasonal_notes: December 31st brings city-wide celebrations and fireworks.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required for public celebrations; restaurants require advance reservations.

activities.name: Winter Art Exhibitions
activities.description: Explore special winter exhibitions at city museums.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter brings special art exhibitions and installations.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online; guided tours available.

activities.name: Oliebollen and Winter Treats
activities.description: Sample traditional Dutch winter treats throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: December brings traditional Dutch winter treats and snacks.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; popular stands are found throughout the city.

ranges.notes: Public holiday, most businesses closed, recovery from New Year's Eve celebrations, winter atmosphere at 18 Septemberplein
Winter sales begin, cold weather, few tourists, good time for museum visits like Van Abbemuseum and Philips Museum
Cold winter weather continues, few tourists, excellent time for museums and indoor attractions
Special menus at restaurants, romantic experiences at creative venues in Strijp-S
Design-focused events and exhibitions throughout the city, particularly in the creative district
Early spring with unpredictable weather, gradual warming, indoor-outdoor activities at covered venues
Design exhibitions and events throughout the city, particularly in Strijp-S
Easter markets at 18 Septemberplein, extended shopping hours, special brunches at restaurants
Spring weather improves, outdoor activities begin, café culture thrives in the city center
Citywide celebrations with street parties, orange outfits, and free markets throughout Eindhoven
Craft beer festival featuring local and international breweries
Public holiday with events in the city center
May 4th (Remembrance Day) and May 5th (Liberation Day) commemorations with ceremonies
Perfect spring conditions, outdoor activities in full swing, excellent time for exploring the city
Early summer weather, excellent for outdoor activities and exploring the city
Music, food, and cultural events throughout the city
Outdoor events, festivals, and activities throughout Eindhoven
Peak summer weather, outdoor activities very popular in city parks and squares
Major cultural festival in the creative district featuring music, art, and design
Final days of the major cultural festival in the creative district
Major running event attracting participants from around the world
Major design event showcasing Dutch design talent throughout the city
Autumn colors in city parks, pleasant temperatures, cultural season begins
Quieter tourism period, increasingly cooler weather, transition to indoor activities
Children's lantern processions and door-to-door singing in residential neighborhoods
Major light art festival transforming the city with spectacular installations
Traditional Dutch holiday celebration with Sinterklaas arriving in the city
Dutch pre-Christmas celebration with gift exchanges and special treats
Holiday markets, festive decorations, and ice skating at 18 Septemberplein
Most businesses close by afternoon, special dining at hotels and restaurants
Public holidays, most businesses closed, quiet atmosphere with limited dining options
Post-Christmas period, winter festival continues, limited business hours
Citywide celebrations and fireworks displays throughout Eindhoven

scoreDescription.1: Poor: Unfavorable conditions, extreme weather, overcrowded or very limited activities
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, possibly unpleasant weather or very low/high tourism (business closures)
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, typical weather, moderate to high tourism
scoreDescription.4: Good: Very favorable conditions, pleasant weather, manageable crowds
scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Perfect conditions, special events, ideal weather, moderate crowds
